questiontext.text: Minimal question : For a minimal question, you must define a subquestion with (1) mark, (2) answer, (3) grading criteria, and optionally (4) question text

Generate random data : Random data can be defined in the random variables such as a = {2,3,4,5};
Upon quiz generation, one deterministic value will be chosen. For example, a takes value {a} in this instantiation.

Multiple subquestions : By default, all subquestions will be added at the end. If placeholder is used, the subquestion will be inserted at the location of placeholder.

--
{#1}
--
{#2}
--

subqtext.text: This is first subquestion.
This is second subquestion.
This is third subquestion.

questiontext.text: Placeholder of answer and unit : This question shows different display methods of the answer and unit box.

subqtext.text:
If a car travel {s} m in {dt} s, what is the speed of the car?
{_0}{_u}

If a car travel {s} m in {dt} s, what is the speed of the car?
{_0} {_u}

If a car travel {s} m in {dt} s, what is the speed of the car?
{_0} m/s

If a car travel {s} m in {dt} s, what is the speed of the car?
speed = {_0} m/s

questiontext.text:
Answer type - Number: You can type in the standard scientific E notation such as: 3.14, 6.626e-34.
Note that the popup under the answer box will check for wrong format, and only show warning sign when the format is wrong.

subqtext.text: If a car travel {s} m in {dt} s, what is the speed of the car?

questiontext.text:
Answer type - Numeric: You can type in numbers and arithmetic operation + - * / ^ and ( ) and constant pi such as: 5+1/2, 2^9, 3pi.
Note that the format check is different from the answer type of number.

subqtext.text: If a car travel {s} m in {dt} s, what is the speed of the car?

questiontext.text: Answer type - Numerical formula : You can type in everything of numeric plus a set of single variable functions sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), exp(), log10(), ln(), sqrt(), abs(), ceil(), floor() such as: sin(pi/12), 10 ln(2)

subqtext.text: Considering a 2D projectile motion with initial speed {v0}m/s and angle {theta}rad from the ground, what is the horizontal distance travelled by the particle in {t0} s?

questiontext.text:
Answer type - Algebraic formula : You can type in every numerical formula and any algebraic variables.
Note that the format check will not tell you which variables are correct, so if you want to hint student about the symbol, you should write them explicitly.
Grading - multiple correct answer : Any grading condition can be entered in the grading criteria.

subqtext.text: Give a number x that is a multiple of 7 and 40 < x < 50.

questiontext.text: Grading - multiple criteria: Two grading criteria are defined here, each of them worth half mark of the question.

subqtext.text: Give a number x that is a multiple of {d} and {a} < x < {b}.

questiontext.text: Grading - Mark for different accuracies: Different grade can be assigned for different accuracies. For the example below, one is smaller than 1% and the other is smaller than 5%.

subqtext.text: The correct answer is 1. (Try to type 2 (wrong), 1.02 (partially correct) and 1.005 (correct) respectively).

questiontext.text: Grading - arbitrary relation: You can also define any grading criteria using any criteria.

subqtext.text:
Write a point that satisfy the condition x < y and x > 0.
x = {_0}
y = {_1}

name.text: 3.5: Grading - multiple answer for algebraic formula

questiontext.text: Grading - multiple answer for algebraic formula: For the comparison of algebraic formula, a usable function is diff(), which is used internal to compare the response and model answer for all answer type.

subqtext.text: Write down one root of f(x). (Suppose the correct answers are "{=answer[0]}", "{=answer[1]}" and "{=answer[2]}")

questiontext.text: Unit - basic conversion rule: If you use the build in conversion "Common SI Unit", you can use the SI units with different prefix, for some of them. You may try other units with different prefix here:

subqtext.text: What is the time spent? (Answer: 5000 ms, try using s)
What is the speed? (Answer: 200 mm/s, try using cm/s)
What is the area? (Answer: 10000 cm^2, try using m^2)

questiontext.text:
Unit - composite unit: Suppose the force is N is defined to be equivalent to kg m/s^2 in the following question.
Note: No basic conversion rule used here.

subqtext.text: What is the force? (The force is 1 N. You can type "1 N" or "1 kg m/s^2" in the answer box.)

questiontext.text:
Unit - other conversion rule: You can enter you conversion rule for base unit.
Note: it uses no basic conversion rule here, so all rules are defined manually

subqtext.text: What is the length of the rod? (Answer: 25.4 cm. Try using inch)

questiontext.text: Possible question type - fraction
Possible question type - vector

subqtext.text:
What is the result of the following vector addition?
({x1},{y1}) + ({x2},{y2}) = ({_0}, {_1})

questiontext.text: Possible question type - matrix: Note that variable substitution occurs before Mathjax filter

subqtext.text:
Compute the following matrix multiplication.
\(\left(\begin{array}{cc}
1 & {a12}\\
3 & 4\end{array}\right)\left(\begin{array}{cc}
0 & 1\\
-1 & 0\end{array}\right)=\left(\begin{array}{c}
\\\\\end{array}\right.\)
{_0}
 {_1}
{_2}
 {_3}
\(\left.\begin{array}{c}\\\\\end{array}\right)\)

questiontext.text: Possible question type - polynomial

subqtext.text:
Expand the following polynomial:
(x-{a})(x-{b})(x-{c}) = {_0}x3 + {_1}x2 + {_2}x + {_3}

questiontext.text: Possible question type - quadratic equation

subqtext.text:
What are the roots of quadratic equation f({symbol}) = {symbol}2 + {b} {symbol} + {c} ? (smaller first)
{symbol} = {_0} or {symbol} = {_1}

questiontext.text: Possible question type - simple differentiation : With variations in the number

subqtext.text: Differentiate {a}x{b}:

questiontext.text:
Other 1: In adaptive mode, for this question, you can try any number of times, but the maximum mark for each trial has 20% deduction

Given line y = {m} x + {c}. What is the y(x) at x = {xr}? {#1}
Can you specify a coordinate point that satisfy the condition y < {m} x + {c}? {#2}
Can you specify a coordinate point that satisfy both condition y < {m} x + {c} and located inside the first quadrant? {#3}

Other 2: In adaptive mode, for this question, five trials are allowed with the maximum mark sequence 100%, 50%, 20%, 0%, 0%

Given a metal rod with a square base with each side {x} mm and height {z} m.
  1. What is the volume of the rod? {#1}
  2. This metal is known to have density {rho} g/cm^3. What is the mass of the rod? {#2}

Other 3: Even in the adaptive mode, you can only try it once.

Suppose the initial position of a car is ({x0},{y0}) m and it travels to ({x1},{y1}) m after t = {tr} s with constant velocity.
  1. What is the average velocity of this car? {#1}
  2. What is the position of the car if it travels with the same velocity for another {ta} s? {#2}

varsglobal.text: x1 = x0 + vx*tr; y1 = y0 + vy*tr;

vars1.text: x2 = x1 + vx*ta; y2 = y1 + vy*ta;

questiontext.text:
Other 4: In adaptive mode, for this question, you can try any number of times, without any mark deduction.

Given three items with mass {x} g, {y} g, {z} g.
  1. What is the mode of the items mass? {#1}
  2. What is the average mass of the items? {#2}
  3. What is the sample standard deviation of the items mass? {#3}

vars1.text: m = (x + y + z)/3.; diffsqr = pow(x-m,2) + pow(y-m,2) + pow(z-m,2);
